slug: /184
title: "This Week In React #184: Patching, Expo, React Aria, Headless UI, Strict Mode, DevTools, Next.js, Mitosis, Twofold, Terminosaurus, Docusaurus, MST, Remix-SaaS, VisionCamera, Reanimated, VisionOS, Apollo, Vite, Node, Hono ..."
authors: [slorber, bndkt]
date: 05-08-2024
---
Hi everyone!
We're back after a short break, covering two weeks of news!

translations.fr: Nous sommes de retour apr√®s une courte pause, couvrant deux semaines d'actualit√©s !
translations.en: Nous sommes de retour apr√®s une courte pause, couvrant deux semaines d'actualit√©s !

segments.source_content: I hope you have recovered well from the React 19 beta release üòÑ But it's not over, we are entering an exciting period with React Conf, Vercel Ship, App.js and many other conferences just around the corner.

translations.fr: J'esp√®re que vous avez bien r√©cup√©r√© de la sortie de React 19 en version b√™ta üòÑ Mais ce n'est pas fini, nous entrons dans une p√©riode passionnante avec React Conf, Vercel Ship, App.js et de nombreuses autres conf√©rences √† venir.
translations.en: J'esp√®re que vous avez bien r√©cup√©r√© de la sortie b√™ta de React 19 üòÑ Mais ce n'est pas termin√©, nous entrons dans une p√©riode excitante avec React Conf, Vercel Ship, App.js et bien d'autres conf√©rences √† venir.

segments.source_content: This week, React patching globals was a hot topic in the ecosystem. We also had a few interesting React-related releases, including 2 major headless libraries.

translations.fr: Cette semaine, le patch de globaux par React a √©t√© un sujet br√ªlant dans l'√©cosyst√®me. Nous avons √©galement eu quelques sorties int√©ressantes li√©es √† React, dont 2 biblioth√®ques headless majeures.
translations.en: Cette semaine, le patch de variables globales par React a √©t√© un sujet br√ªlant dans l'√©cosyst√®me. Nous avons √©galement eu quelques sorties int√©ressantes li√©es √† React, dont 2 biblioth√®ques headless majeures.

segments.source_content: As expected, Expo SDK 51 is out, and it looks like it's a good time to try out the New Architecture.

translations.fr: Comme pr√©vu, Expo SDK 51 est sorti, et il semble que ce soit le bon moment pour essayer la Nouvelle Architecture.
translations.en: Comme pr√©vu, Expo SDK 51 est sorti, et il semble que ce soit le bon moment pour essayer la Nouvelle Architecture.

segments.source_content: Looking for a great React summer conf? [React Rally](https://reactrally.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) tickets are on sale (August 12-13, üá∫üá∏ Utah). Our readers get a [10% discount](https://ti.to/react-rally/react-rally-2024/discount/TWIR) with code "TWIR".

segments.source_content: ## ‚öõÔ∏è React {#react}
[![React Aria release, May 1](/emails/issues/184/reactaria.jpg)](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/releases/2024-05-01.html)
[**React Aria release, May 1**](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/releases/2024-05-01.html)
Adobe engineers recently released many improvements to their unstyled, accessible React component library. The highlights are:

translations.fr: Les ing√©nieurs d'Adobe ont r√©cemment publi√© de nombreuses am√©liorations √† leur biblioth√®que de composants React accessibles et sans style. Les points forts sont :
translations.en: Les ing√©nieurs d'Adobe ont r√©cemment publi√© de nombreuses am√©liorations √† leur biblioth√®que de composants React accessibles et non styl√©s. Les points forts sont :

segments.source_content:
- Submenu, see the [dedicated blog post](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/blog/creating-a-pointer-friendly-submenu-experience.html)
- 7 new color picker components
- TreeView alpha
- DropZone + FileTrigger
- Typed client-side router integration
- onAction/isDisabled item API
- Better tree shaking (~4x smaller)

translations.fr:
- Sous-menu, voir le [billet de blog d√©di√©](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/blog/creating-a-pointer-friendly-submenu-experience.html)
- 7 nouveaux composants de s√©lection de couleur
- TreeView en alpha
- DropZone + FileTrigger
- Int√©gration typ√©e de routeur c√¥t√© client
- API d'√©l√©ment onAction/isDisabled
- Meilleur tree shaking (~4x plus l√©ger)
translations.en:
- Sous-menus, voir le [billet de blog d√©di√©](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/blog/creating-a-pointer-friendly-submenu-experience.html)
- 7 nouveaux composants de s√©lection de couleur
- TreeView en alpha
- DropZone + FileTrigger
- Int√©gration router client typ√©
- API onAction/isDisabled pour les √©l√©ments
- Meilleur tree shaking (~4x plus l√©ger)

segments.source_content: [![Headless UI v2.0 for React](/emails/issues/184/headlessui.jpg)](https://tailwindcss.com/blog/headless-ui-v2)
[**Headless UI v2.0 for React**](https://tailwindcss.com/blog/headless-ui-v2)
The Tailwind team released a major upgrade to their unstyled, accessible React component library. The highlights are:

translations.fr: L'√©quipe Tailwind a publi√© une mise √† jour majeure de leur biblioth√®que de composants React accessibles et sans style. Les points forts sont :
translations.en: L'√©quipe Tailwind a publi√© une mise √† jour majeure de leur biblioth√®que de composants React non stylis√©s et accessibles. Les points forts sont :

segments.source_content:
- Built-in anchor positioning, using Floating UI
- New form element components: Checkbox, Input, Label, Field
- Combobox list virtualization using TanStack Virtual
- Hover/focus/active data attributes using React Aria
- New docs website

translations.fr:
- Positionnement d'ancrage int√©gr√©, utilisant Floating UI
- Nouveaux composants d'√©l√©ments de formulaire : Checkbox, Input, Label, Field
- Virtualisation de liste Combobox utilisant TanStack Virtual
- Attributs de donn√©es hover/focus/active utilisant React Aria
- Nouveau site de documentation
translations.en:
- Positionnement d'ancrage int√©gr√© utilisant Floating UI
- Nouveaux composants d'√©l√©ments de formulaire : Checkbox, Input, Label, Field
- Virtualisation de liste Combobox utilisant TanStack Virtual
- Attributs de donn√©es hover/focus/active utilisant React Aria
- Nouveau site de documentation

segments.source_content:
- üí∏ [React Universe Conf - Previously React Native EU. Experts from React & React Native under one roof! Use code RUCxTWIR to get a 10% discount.](https://www.reactuniverseconf.com/tickets-2024?utm_campaign=React_Universe_Conf&utm_source=email&utm_content=This_Week_in_React)
- üí¨ [Why doesn't Next.js expose the request and response objects in Layouts?](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/issues/43704#issuecomment-2090798307): Delba explains exposing more APIs would prevent Next.js from optimizing code in the future (notably through Partial Prerendering), and gives us alternatives. This [workaround](https://www.propelauth.com/post/getting-url-in-next-server-components) made me smile: putting request data in a header through a middleware to be able to access it.
- üí¨ [Vite RFC - Environment API](https://github.com/vitejs/vite/discussions/16358): This upcoming Vite 6 feature should help support React Server Components in Vite. This could also make Vite a viable choice for React Native, which needs to handle one module graph per native platform.
- üëÄ [React DevTools 5.2 PR](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/29022): components optimized by the React Compiler will show a ‚Äú‚ú® Memo‚Äù badge, including in the profiler. We can now debug/inspect useFormStatus. There is also work around ‚ÄúFusebox‚Äù, a new codename for React Native DevTools.
- üëÄ [Next.js PR - Support React 19 in App and Pages router](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/65058)
- üëÄ [React Core PR - Support useFormStatus in progressively-enhanced forms](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/29019)
- üê¶ [React might patch the Date API to avoid hydration mismatch](https://x.com/acdlite/status/1785691330988986587)
- üê¶ [React 19 will "fire" refs twice under StrictMode](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1787814604170485770)
- üê¶ [React 19 beta - Rick Hanlon‚Äôs Ask Me Anything](https://twitter.com/rickhanlonii/status/1783906285957587194)
- üîó [Remix for Next.js Developers](https://remixfornextdevs.com): Convenient resource with side-by-side code snippets.
- üóì [React Summit](https://reactsummit.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - üá≥üá± Amsterdam - 14-18 June - Get a 10% discount with code "TWIR".
- üóì [dotJS](https://www.dotjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - üá´üá∑ Paris - June 27 - Less than 2 months before the conference, the speaker line-up is announced! 10% discount with code "TWIR"
- üìú [Why Patching Globals Is Harmful](https://kettanaito.com/blog/why-patching-globals-is-harmful): An interesting read related to the bad practice of patching globals, taking React, Next.js, and Bun as examples. I agree that explicitly imported APIs are better, but it wouldn‚Äôt allow React to dedupe RSC fetch requests from third-party npm SDKs.
- üìú [Modern React testing - Playwright](https://sapegin.me/blog/react-testing-5-playwright/): A great resource to start implementing E2E React tests in your apps, using Playwright, Mock Service Worker, and React Testing Library.
- üìú [React Strict Mode and Race Condition](https://www.nico.fyi/blog/react-strict-mode-and-race-condition): Highlights a subtle behavior you might encounter if you cancel requests in useEffect with AbortController.
- üìú [Getting Started with Mitosis - Creating a Cross-Framework Design System](https://www.builder.io/blog/mitosis-get-started): Mitosis allows you to compile a JSX component to React/RN/Angular/Vue/Svelte. It also has a brand new website.
- üìú [Locality of Behavior in React Components](https://alexkondov.com/locality-of-behavior-react/): Reflection around abstracting vs inlining code in a React component. Things that change together should live together.
- üìú [How to make edge rendering fast](https://developers.netlify.com/guides/how-to-make-edge-rendering-fast/): Netlify‚Äôs CEO takes an edge-rendered Remix app and explains how introducing an extra serverless function + CDN caching could speed up your app.
- üìú [Combining Pixi-React and HTML with Tunnels](https://jallen.dev/blog/pixi-react-tunnels): When using multiple React renderers, a tunnel library might help you keep things grouped by concern.
- üìú [Upcoming custom element support in React](https://piccalil.li/blog/upcoming-custom-element-support-in-react/): React 19 beta passes 100% of the Custom Elements Everywhere benchmark. Combining React with custom elements looks like an interesting choice in the future.
- üìú [Replace Your HTML Entry Point with React](https://danielnagy.me/posts/Post_2mewtbsl6g4c): Uses React to render the entire document in Vite. It‚Äôs not so simple, but this can be useful for SSR streaming support.
- üìú [10 Features Next.js 15 Could Launch](https://notebook.lachlanjc.com/2024-04-17_10_features_nextjs_15_could_launch): Predict possible announcements at Vercel Ship conf.
- üìú [Nuances of Server Actions in Next.js](https://tigerabrodi.blog/nuances-of-server-actions-in-nextjs)
- üì¶ [React Router 6.23 - Data Strategy API (unstable)](https://github.com/remix-run/react-router/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#v6230): Enables new Remix 2.9 Single Fetch feature, firing one request for all loaders instead of one per loader.
- üì¶ [Terminosaurus - Graphical UI library for terminals, including React renderer integration](https://mael.dev/terminosaurus/)
- üì¶ [Twofold - Framework for building demos with React Server Components](https://twofoldframework.com/)
- üì¶ [Mobx-State-Tree 6.0 - hasEnv, TypeScript, perf improvements](https://github.com/mobxjs/mobx-state-tree/discussions/2180)
- üì¶ [Zustand-Valtio - Interesting alternative to Zustand + Immer](https://github.com/zustandjs/zustand-valtio)
- üì¶ [Hono 4.3 - Hono JSX improves compatibility with React, can render Radix UI primitives](https://github.com/honojs/hono/releases/tag/v4.3.0)
- üì¶ [Docusaurus 3.3 - Handle React 18.3 warnings, createSitemapItems, pages plugin improvements](https://docusaurus.io/blog/releases/3.3)
- üì¶ [Apollo Client 3.10 - Schema-based testing utilities, client.watchFragment, stable createQueryPreloader](https://www.apollographql.com/blog/whats-new-in-apollo-client-3-10)
- üì¶ [use-context-selector 2.0 - Drops React < 18](https://github.com/dai-shi/use-context-selector)
- üì¶ [Remix-SaaS - A free, lightweight, production-ready Remix Stack for your next SaaS app](https://github.com/dev-xo/remix-saas)
- üé• [Theo - React's New Controversial Override](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PAf6NjyCnrI)
- üéôÔ∏è [This Month in React - React 19 beta, Node 22, Expo 51, RN 0.74, Next.js 14.2 ‚Ä¶](https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/reactiflux/episodes/TMiR-2024-05-So-many-new-releases--React-19-featureset-e2jbc64)

segments.source_content: Too many custom or outdated components, not enough reuse? Not with Omlet. Omlet scans your codebase and instantly provides pre-built and custom charts on:

translations.en: Trop de composants personnalis√©s ou obsol√®tes, pas assez de r√©utilisation ? Pas avec Omlet. Omlet scanne votre base de code et fournit instantan√©ment des graphiques pr√©d√©finis et personnalis√©s sur :

segments.source_content: ## üì± React-Native {#react-native}
This section is authored by [Benedikt](https://twitter.com/bndkt).
[![Expo SDK 51](/emails/issues/184/expo51.jpg)](https://expo.dev/changelog/2024/05-07-sdk-51)
[**Expo SDK 51**](https://expo.dev/changelog/2024/05-07-sdk-51)

Hot on the heels of React Native 0.74 follows the release of Expo SDK 51. This release mostly advances the internal architecture and promotes some previously experimental packages to the new default, so let me quickly get out of the way the topics we have already covered in this newsletter: New Architecture support for most Expo modules (there are still some [known issues](https://docs.expo.dev/guides/new-architecture/#known-issues-in-expo-sdk-libraries)), Bridgeless support, support for Apple‚Äôs privacy manifest, ‚Äúnext‚Äù versions of camera and sqlite package are now the default, Fingerprint no longer experimental. But there is also a new expo-symbols package featuring Apple‚Äôs SF Symbols library (iOS only), a new expo-video library, Expo Router 3.5 release with support for the # segment in URLs, and improvements to EAS Update (e.g. a web UI to roll out updates gradually). I expect bigger announcements around Expo Router (RSC üëÄ) at the upcoming React Conf, so stay tuned! One other significant change is that Expo Go, starting with version 51, only supports one single version of the Expo SDK. This decision makes absolute sense to me as it makes maintenance of the Expo Go app a lot easier and for most use cases, you should be using Expo Dev Client anyways.

translations.fr: Juste apr√®s React Native 0.74 suit la sortie d'Expo SDK 51. Cette version fait surtout avancer l'architecture interne et promeut certains packages pr√©c√©demment exp√©rimentaux comme nouveaux d√©fauts, alors permettez-moi d'aborder rapidement les sujets que nous avons d√©j√† couverts dans cette newsletter : la prise en charge de la Nouvelle Architecture pour la plupart des modules Expo (il y a encore quelques [probl√®mes connus](https://docs.expo.dev/guides/new-architecture/#known-issues-in-expo-sdk-libraries)), la prise en charge de Bridgeless, la prise en charge du manifeste de confidentialit√© d'Apple, les versions ¬´ next ¬ª des packages camera et sqlite sont maintenant les d√©fauts, Fingerprint n'est plus exp√©rimental. Mais il y a aussi un nouveau package expo-symbols pr√©sentant la biblioth√®que SF Symbols d'Apple (iOS uniquement), une nouvelle biblioth√®que expo-video, la sortie d'Expo Router 3.5 avec prise en charge du segment # dans les URL, et des am√©liorations √† EAS Update (par exemple une interface web pour d√©ployer les mises √† jour progressivement). Je m'attends √† des annonces plus importantes autour d'Expo Router (RSC üëÄ) √† la prochaine React Conf, donc restez √† l'√©coute ! Un autre changement significatif est qu'Expo Go, √† partir de la version 51, ne prend en charge qu'une seule version du SDK Expo. Cette d√©cision a parfaitement sens pour moi car elle facilite grandement la maintenance de l'application Expo Go et pour la plupart des cas d'utilisation, vous devriez de toute fa√ßon utiliser Expo Dev Client.
translations.en: Juste apr√®s React Native 0.74 suit la sortie d'Expo SDK 51. Cette version fait principalement progresser l'architecture interne et promeut certains packages pr√©c√©demment exp√©rimentaux en tant que nouveaux param√®tres par d√©faut. Permettez-moi d'aborder rapidement les sujets d√©j√† couverts dans cette newsletter : prise en charge de la New Architecture pour la plupart des modules Expo (il reste quelques [probl√®mes connus](https://docs.expo.dev/guides/new-architecture/#known-issues-in-expo-sdk-libraries)), prise en charge de Bridgeless, prise en charge du manifeste de confidentialit√© d'Apple, les versions "next" des packages camera et sqlite sont d√©sormais les valeurs par d√©faut, Fingerprint n'est plus exp√©rimental. Mais il y a aussi un nouveau package expo-symbols avec la biblioth√®que SF Symbols d'Apple (iOS uniquement), une nouvelle biblioth√®que expo-video, la version 3.5 d'Expo Router avec prise en charge du segment # dans les URL, et des am√©liorations √† EAS Update (par exemple une interface web pour d√©ployer les mises √† jour progressivement). Je m'attends √† des annonces plus importantes autour d'Expo Router (RSC üëÄ) √† la prochaine React Conf, donc restez √† l'√©coute ! Un autre changement significatif est qu'Expo Go, √† partir de la version 51, ne prend en charge qu'une seule version du SDK Expo. Cette d√©cision me semble parfaitement logique car elle facilite grandement la maintenance de l'application Expo Go et dans la plupart des cas, vous devriez de toute fa√ßon utiliser Expo Dev Client.
